question: A total of 5000 patients of glaucoma are identified and surveyed by patient interviews regarding family history of glaucoma. Such a study design is called-
exp: Case series repo: A case series repo is a descriptive study where in more than one patients having a paicular disease are studied. No cause related analysis or hypothesis testing is involved. Case control study: Backward looking/ retrospective study in which multiple risk factors are studied together. Odd's ratio can be calculated. Coho study: Forward / prospective study in which multiple outcomes can be studied together. Incidence & relative risk can be calculated.

question: Which of the following is false about Longitudinal studies?
exp: Longitudinal studies Longitudinal studies are defined as studies having a direction. Longitudinal studies : Helps us study natural history of a disease. Helps in identification of risk factors of a disease. Helps in find out rate of occurrence of new cases of a diseases. Difficult to organize and more time consuming. Includes 1. Coho study :Forward (prospective) direction; 2 . Case control study :Backward (retrospective) direction. Veical study/ Non-longitudinal study : Include cross-sectional study aka snapshot/ prevalence study , Ecological study aka co-relational study.
opa: Helps us study natural history of a disease
opb: Helps in identification of risk factor of a disease
opc: Helps us find out rate of occurrence of new cases of a disease
opd: Easy to organize and less time consuming

question: All are analytical studies except-
exp: Analytical studies consists of : Cross sectional/prevalence study Ecological study Case control study Coho study Experimental study consists of : RCT Field trial Community Trial Clinical trial

question: In a study in UK, an association was found between sale of anti-arrhythmic drug and an increase in deaths due to asthma. This is an example of:-
exp: Here we are looking at association between sale of a drug and increase in asthma, with no individual study of consumption of that drug & then getting asthma. Thus, it is Ecological study/ co-relational study. Ecological study is neither forward nor backward study, done at point of time. It can't calculate strength of association/ prevalence. It is based on Secondary data.
